text: The 1992–93 Wills Trophy was a One Day International (ODI) cricket tri-series where the United Arab Emirates played host to Pakistan, Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe. Pakistan and Sri Lanka reached the final, which Pakistan won. India were invited to join the competition, but declined in protest at the umpiring in the 1991–92 competition. ==Points Table== {| class="wikitable" |- ! width=38% |Team ! width=7% |P ! width=7% |W ! width=7% |L ! width=7% |T ! width=9% |RR ! width=9% |Points |- bgcolor=ccffcc |align=left| || 2 || 2 || 0 || 0 || 4.904 || 4 |- bgcolor=ccffcc |align=left| || 2 || 1 || 1 || 0 || 5.011 || 2 |- bgcolor=pink |align=left| || 2 || 0 || 2 || 0 || 4.828 || 0 |} == Group matches == ===First match=== ===Second match=== ===Third match=== ==Final== ==References== Category:International cricket competitions from 1991–92 to 1994 Category:One Day International cricket competitions
